thread.title: Moderate Mag. 4.6 Earthquake - North Pacific Ocean, 82 km Southeast of Escuintla, Guatemala, on Wednesday, Nov 19, 2025, at 03:09 pm (Guatemala Time)
thread.title_full: Moderate Mag. 4.6 Earthquake - North Pacific Ocean, 82 km Southeast of Escuintla, Guatemala, on Wednesday, Nov 19, 2025, at 03:09 pm (Guatemala Time)

author: @EQAlerts
title: Moderate Mag. 4.6 Earthquake - North Pacific Ocean, 82 km Southeast of Escuintla, Guatemala, on Wednesday, Nov 19, 2025, at 03:09 pm (Guatemala Time)
text:
Translate
Antigua, Guatemala (104.2 km NNW of epicenter) [Map] / Very weak shaking (MMI II) / horizontal (sideways) swinging / 1-2 s : It felt like the earth doing a little shimmy or hoop dance. I could almost see my room swaying right and left though it was also reeeally gentle. Yet still I heard sirens afterwards. It’s just shook again a couple times a little bit, a couple minutes later, it’s weird, almost like a fractal, little tiny aftershocks of a little earthquake, and a couple minutes later the earth is still shaking once in a while very subtly without making any noise. There was a little noise the first time. Then in between those shocks there were even more barely perceptible ones. | One user found this interesting.
Izalco, Sonsonate Department (75.9 km E of epicenter) [Map] / Weak shaking (MMI III) / rattling, vibrating / very short : It was short | One user found this interesting.
Chinautla, Guatemala (112 km N of epicenter) [Map] / not felt (reported through
our app)

our app)

Villa Nueva, Guatemala (97.1 km NNW of epicenter) [Map] / Weak shaking (MMI III) / single lateral shake / 20-30 s : Estaba sentada
Antigua (122 km NW of epicenter) [Map] / Very weak shaking (MMI II) / horizontal (sideways) swinging / 2-5 s : I was laying in bed
Antigua guatemala (102.1 km NNW of epicenter) [Map] / Weak shaking (MMI III) / very short
Guatemala City (104.6 km N of epicenter) [Map] / not felt (reported through
our app)
